definitions.example: My life is ruined because of you!

definitions.definition: (by ellipsis) Used alone to refuse to provide a full answer a question begun with "why", usually taken as an anapodoton of the elided full phrase "Because I said so".
By or for the cause that; on this account that; for the reason that.
definitions.example: I hid myself because I was afraid.

definitions.definition: As is known, inferred, or determined from the fact that.
definitions.example: I don't think he is a nice person, because he yells at people for no reason.
